soot.jimple.infoflow.data

Class Abstraction

  • java.lang.Object
    • soot.jimple.infoflow.data.Abstraction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    heros.solver.LinkedNode<Abstraction>, java.lang.Cloneable, FastSolverLinkedNode<Abstraction,soot.Unit>

    public class Abstraction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, FastSolverLinkedNode<Abstraction,soot.Unit>
    The abstraction class contains all information that is necessary to track the taint.
    Author:
    Steven Arzt, Christian Fritz

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private AccessPath accessPath
      the access path contains the currently tainted variable or field
      private soot.Unit activationUnit
      Unit/Stmt which activates the taint when the abstraction passes it
      private soot.jimple.Stmt correspondingCallSite 
      private soot.jimple.Stmt currentStmt 
      private boolean dependsOnCutAP
      Only valid for inactive abstractions.
      private boolean exceptionThrown
      taint is thrown by an exception (is set to false when it reaches the catch-Stmt)
      private static boolean flowSensitiveAliasing 
      private int hashCode 
      private boolean isImplicit 
      private java.util.Set<Abstraction> neighbors 
      private java.util.Set<SourceContextAndPath> pathCache 
      private AtomicBitSet pathFlags 
      private java.util.List<IInfoflowCFG.UnitContainer> postdominators
      The postdominators we need to pass in order to leave the current conditional branch.
      private Abstraction predecessor 
      private SourceContext sourceContext

      • postdominators

        private java.util.List<IInfoflowCFG.UnitContainer> postdominators
        The postdominators we need to pass in order to leave the current conditional branch. Do not use the synchronized Stack class here to avoid deadlocks.

      • isImplicit

        private boolean isImplicit

      • dependsOnCutAP

        private boolean dependsOnCutAP
        Only valid for inactive abstractions. Specifies whether an access paths has been cut during alias analysis.

        private AtomicBitSet pathFlags

        public final Abstraction deriveNewAbstractionOnThrow(soot.jimple.Stmt throwStmt)
        Derives a new abstraction that models the current local being thrown as an exception
        Parameters:
        throwStmt - The statement at which the exception was thrown
        Returns:
        The newly derived abstraction

        Derives a new abstraction that models the current local being caught as an exception
        Parameters:
        taint - The value in which the tainted exception is stored
        Returns:
        The newly derived abstraction

      • getPaths

        public java.util.Set<SourceContextAndPath> getPaths()
        Gets the path of statements from the source to the current statement with which this abstraction is associated. If this path is ambiguous, a single path is selected randomly.
        Returns:
        The path from the source to the current statement

      • entails

        public boolean entails(Abstraction other)
        Checks whether this abstraction entails the given abstraction, i.e. this taint also taints everything that is tainted by the given taint.
        Parameters:
        other - The other taint abstraction
        Returns:
        True if this object at least taints everything that is also tainted by the given object

      • registerPathFlag

        public boolean registerPathFlag(int id,
                                int maxSize)
        Registers that a worker thread with the given ID has already processed this abstraction
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the worker thread
        Returns:
        True if the worker thread with the given ID has not been registered before, otherwise false

      • setAccessPath

        void setAccessPath(AccessPath accessPath)
        For internal use by memory manager only. Setting a new access path will not update any dependent data such as cached hashes. Handle with care!
